patch.name-description: Security update when starting Linux VMs.
Stability update for large hotfixes.
Performance update for Citrix Presentation Server.
Reliability update for newer-style VHD files.

This patch fixes the vulnerability described in CVE-2007-5497: Multiple integer overflows in e2fsprogs allow user-assisted remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted filesystem image. See http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5497 for more information.
Some versions of NetApp ONTAP on StoreVault have issues connecting to XenServer 4.0.96 beta2 hosts. This hotfix against XenServer 4.0.96 addresses the issue.

This patch fixes the vulnerability described in CVE-2007-5497: Multiple integer overflows in e2fsprogs allow user-assisted remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted filesystem image. See http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5497 for more information.

This patch improves reliability and performance of the Xen hypervisor, removes the need for an NFS license in the NetApp SR, and corrects an issue with occasionally losing disk associations when rebooting hosts with NFS storage repositories attached.

This patch upgrades the XenServer Windows Tools with support for Windows XP SP3 and the popular Daemontools utility. It also addresses an issue with joining hosts to a resource pool which uses VLANs. Install the first update before applying this one.

Includes contents of Citrix Hotfix 1: This patch improves reliability and performance of the Xen hypervisor, removes the need for an NFS license in the NetApp SR, and corrects an issue with occasionally losing disk associations when rebooting hosts with NFS storage repositories attached.

Includes contents of Citrix Hotfix 1 and 2: This patch upgrades the XenServer Windows Tools with support for Windows XP SP3 and the popular Daemontools utility. It also addresses an issue with joining hosts to a resource pool which uses VLANs. This patch improves reliability and performance of the Xen hypervisor, removes the need for an NFS license in the NetApp SR, and corrects an issue with occasionally losing disk associations when rebooting hosts with NFS storage repositories attached.

This patch fixes the vulnerability described in CVE-2007-5497: Multiple integer overflows in e2fsprogs allow user-assisted remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted filesystem image. See http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5497 for more information.

Includes contents of Citrix Hotfix 1 and 2: This patch upgrades the XenServer Windows Tools with support for Windows XP SP3 and the popular Daemontools utility. It also addresses an issue with joining hosts to a resource pool which uses VLANs. This patch improves reliability and performance of the Xen hypervisor, removes the need for an NFS license in the NetApp SR, and corrects an issue with occasionally losing disk associations when rebooting hosts with NFS storage repositories attached.

This patch fixes the vulnerability described in CVE-2007-5497: Multiple integer overflows in e2fsprogs allow user-assisted remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted filesystem image. See http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5497 for more information.
